page.title: 04FARMING NEAR NANCLEDRA
page.content: Mrs.Edwards,Amalebra Farm, Nancledra. Mr and Mrs Edwards own fifty acres on which they raise{beef}and grow{corn.} They lease more land for pasture away from the farm.They have one son who works on the farm assisted by casual labour.The family have occupied this farm for thirty seven years.The{farm {house}comprises three bedrooms, bathroom lounge and kitchen.Mrs Edwards rises at six thirty every morning.The beef cows are mainly Hereford and Friesian cross, they are sold at Camborne market.They do their shopping at Norman's in Camborne market. If they go out for the day for {entertainment}they would visit Penzance. The Edward's grow their own fruit and vegetables. They let out a nearby house to holidaymakers.
